meanings.definition: To give a definite or official structure or shape to

meanings.sent2: The team worked together to formalise a strategy for the upcoming project.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to formalise his disappearing act but ended up in a box himself.
meanings.sent4: The chef aimed to formalise the presentation of the dish with intricate garnishes.
meanings.sent5: The tailor wanted to formalise the dress pattern to ensure a perfect fit.

meanings.sent2: The company policy was updated to formalise the new safety regulations.
